author: Rett Nelson
title: New pastor for two local churches invites community to worship and barbecue event - East Idaho News
text: Published at IDAHO FALLS – Elizabeth McVicker found faith when she immigrated to the U.S. with her parents as a child. She’s now a pastor in Idaho Falls, and she’s inviting the community to a worship service and barbecue later this month. As of March 1, the 55-year-old Oklahoma woman is the new reverend at Trinity United Methodist Church and St. Paul’s United Methodist Church in Idaho Falls. She’s hosting the community event on June 30 to “foster unity and share God’s love.” “It’s really to let people know that Methodism is a place where all people are welcome,” McVicker tells EastIdahoNews.com. “Anyone who is looking for a community of people who are authentic, we’re hosting this worship and barbecue.” The worship service will begin at 10 a.m. inside St. Paul’s at 1730 St. Clair Road. Communion will be given to those in attendance. Hamburgers, hot dogs, Farr’s ice cream and other desserts will be served outside the church following the service. There will also be activities and live entertainment. It’s free and open to anyone who wants to attend. After the recent departure of the two church’s pastors, both congregations will be sharing the same reverend. Trinity United has had an interim pastor since July when its previous reverend, Ruth Marsh, took a ministry assignment in Oregon. Similarly, St. Paul’s had been without a pastor four about two years. McVicker was assigned by the bishop, an ordained elder assigned to preside over the church in a regional area, to come to Idaho Falls. McVicker previously served in Salt Lake City, and she’s enjoyed getting acclimated in eastern Idaho and serving the community. “Idaho Falls is a remarkable community,” says McVicker. “I’m enjoying the high caliber of performing arts here and the amazing outdoors. When I drove around downtown, I just felt very at home.” Trinity United’s ministry to the homeless population is another thing that appeals to her about this assignment. That was a main focus of her ministry in Salt Lake and she’s glad to continue that tradition. RELATED | Finding Faith as an addict: How a former Latter-day Saint found love and acceptance as a Methodist McVicker was born in Rangoon, Burma, a country in southeast Asia. She is “full-blooded Chinese” and her parents came to America seeking escape from a Socialist government. She grew up attending the Methodist Church with her parents in Tulsa, Oklahoma. She participated in the choir and Sunday school. She gained a deep love for the people and the faith. After graduating from Yale, she was planning to get a doctorate at the University of California, Berkeley but decided to take a break. “I enrolled in seminary in Berkeley. That first semester is when I actually felt called into ministry,” McVicker explains. She was ordained in 1997. Her first ministerial assignment was in Phoenix, Arizona. She served in Cheyenne, Wyoming, for seven years before being called to Salt Lake in 2016. “Idaho Falls feels a lot like Cheyenne — similar size population,” McVicker says. RELATED | United Methodists repeal longstanding ban on LGBTQ clergy Last month, the Methodist Church repealed its longstanding ban on LGBTQ clergy. McVicker says they also embrace people of all identities in their congregation. “We’re open to people of all human sexualities and gender identities. There’s no requirement, no criteria people have to meet in order to receive Holy Communion in the Methodist Church. I think that is very unique in the world of Christendom, and we want people to know that we’re here,” she says. She invites the community to worship and attend the event on June 30.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 农业ETF（516550）跌0.75%，半日成交额366.06万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，农业ETF（516550）跌0.75%，报0.660元，成交额366.06万元。农业ETF（516550）重仓股方面， 东鹏饮料 截止午盘跌0.80%， 温氏股份 跌0.58%， 牧原股份 跌0.56%， 伊利股份 跌0.39%， 盐湖股份 跌0.85%， 海天味业 跌3.23%， 海大集团 跌0.14%， 云天化 跌0.75%， 藏格矿业 跌0.34%， 双汇发展 跌0.16%。
农业ETF（516550）业绩比较基准为 中证大农业指数 收益率，管理人为嘉实基金管理有限公司，基金经理为李直，成立（2021-03-30）以来回报为-33.38%，近一个月回报为3.27%。

author: Shabee Lakehouse
title: War Heroes Commemoration Flag’ pinned on President - DailyNews
text: In a declaration of War Heroes Commemoration Month, the National War Heroes Flag was pinned on President Ranil Wickremesinghe this morning (06) at the Presidential Secretariat. Chairman of the Ranaviru Seva Authority, Major General Nishantha Manage (Retired), presented the Ranaviru flag to the President, the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces. Annually, the month of May is officially designated as ‘War Heroes Commemoration Month’, serving as a solemn tribute to the valiant soldiers who made the ultimate sacrifice in defence of the nation’s territorial integrity during the protracted three-decade-long conflict. A considerable number of servicemen from the tri-forces made the ultimate sacrifice for the country, while an equivalent number suffered injuries in the on-going struggle against terrorism. Each year marking the commencement of Ranaviru month, the national war hero flag is ceremonially pinned to the esteemed President by the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces during the first week of May. The President of the Ranaviru Seva Authority also presented President Ranil Wickremesinghe with a model plaque of the Ranaviru flag. The event was graced by the presence of esteemed individuals including the President’s Senior Advisor on National Security and Chief of Presidential Staff, Sagala Ratnayaka, Secretary to the President Saman Ekanayake, Defence Secretary General Kamal Gunaratne (Retired) and other distinguished guests.

author: KVUE Staff
title: CNN Travel lauds the Hill Country as one of the best places to visit in the world
text: stop and smell the bluebonnets CNN Travel lauds the Hill Country as one of the best places to visit in the world A new report says that one of the [best places](https://austin.culturemap.com/news/travel/hill-country-best-places-travel/) to [visit](https://austin.culturemap.com/news/travel/hill-country-best-places-travel/) in the entire world is right here in Central Texas. [CNN Travel](https://www.cnn.com/travel) named the Texas Hill Country one of the [best places to visit in the world in 2024](https://www.cnn.com/travel/best-destinations-to-visit-2024/index.html). The region was included alongside 23 other destinations, including Greece, Morocco, Panama and Greenland. CNN Travel said the intention of the report was to highlight "places that are still largely undiscovered, or alluring in the offseason, or frequently overlooked for their larger first cities or neighbors." It also includes locales that it says are "making it easier for tourists to visit and those that pay close attention to encouraging tourism that's sustainable." The Central Texas area is one of only three destinations in the U.S. featured in the report. The others are northwest Michigan and Florida's freshwater springs. In the report, CNN Travel cited the Hill Country's springs, trails, wineries, dance halls and more as reasons for globetrotters to make a stop. Below is the full entry on the region: "In the heart of Texas, Hill Country boasts its own natural springs. One prime spot, [Krause Springs](https://laketravis.com/lake-travis/krause-springs/) in Spicewood, lures visitors with more than its spring-fed pool and natural swimming hole — there’s also a butterfly garden full of magical wind chimes. And the [Blue Bonnet Cafe](https://www.bluebonnetcafe.net/) — home to some of the world’s most divine cream pies — is just a short drive away in [Marble Falls](https://visitmarblefalls.org/). [...] -- Read the full story and watch the video at CultureMap news partner [KVUE.com](https://www.kvue.com/article/news/local/texas-hill-country-best-places-to-visit-world-2024/269-214fee17-242e-471c-88ed-b7ff59da968e#:~:text=TEXAS%2C%20USA%20%E2%80%94%20A%20new%20report,%2C%20Morocco%2C%20Panama%20and%20Greenland.).
